TI TEMPERATURE-DEPENDENCE OF (MU(-)O) PARAMAGNETIC SHIFT IN HIGH T-C
   SUPERCONDUCTOR LA2-XSRXCUO4
SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT Yamada Conference XXXIV, The IXth International Conference on Hyperfine
   Interactions (HFI-IX)
CY AUG 17-21, 1992
CL TOYONAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
AB In order to investigate the electronic structure around oxygen in superconducting La2-xSrxCuO4 (x = 0.10 and 0.14), precise measurements were carried out on the paramagnetic Knight shifts in the spin rotation frequency of the negative muon bound to the oxygen with reference to antiferromagnetic La2-xSrxCuO4 (x = 0.05). Remarkable temperature as well as crystalline-axis dependence was observed for the high T-c case with a divergence character towards T-c. Possible mechanisms to explain the observed results are given.

TI COMPETITION OF MAGNETIC ORDER AND SUPERCONDUCTIVITY INVESTIGATED BY
   POSITIVE MUON SPIN ROTATION IN LA(2-X)M(X)CUO(4) (M=BA, SR) AROUND
   X=0.12
SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT Yamada Conference XXXIV, The IXth International Conference on Hyperfine
   Interactions (HFI-IX)
CY AUG 17-21, 1992
CL TOYONAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
ID STRUCTURAL PHASE-TRANSITION; NUCLEAR HEAT-CAPACITY; LOW-TEMPERATURE
   PHASE; LA2-XBAXCUO4; ANOMALIES; MOMENTS; TRANSPORT
AB Muon spin rotation(mu SR) is applied to La2_xBaxCuO4 around x = 0.12 where the superconductivity (SC) is suppressed remarkably. The magnetic ordering of Cu-moments appears below 35 K in the narrow range of x where a lattice instability from the low temperature orthorhombic (LTO) to the low-temperature tetragonal (LTT) structure exists. The present study suggests strongly that the magnetic ordering of Cu-moments is an important factor in the suppression of high-T-c superconductivity around x = 0.12 in La2-xBaxCuO4. Similar results are obtained for the La2-xSrxCUO4 and La2-x-ySrxNdyCuO4 systems.

TI MUONIUM EMISSION AND REACTION ON PLATINUM AND GOLD POWDER SURFACES
   REVEALED BY MUSR
SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT Yamada Conference 34 / 9th International Conference on Hyperfine
   Interactions ( HFI-IX )
CY AUG 17-21, 1992
CL TOYONAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
HO OSAKA UNIV, FAC SCI, DEPT PHYS & LAB NUCL STUDIES
AB Muonium has been observed in powdered platinum (30 nm diameter) and gold (100 nm diameter), respectively, placed in vacuum by the muonium spin rotation (MuSR) technique at ambient temperature. Upon introducing gaseous oxygen up to 23 Torr into platinum powder, the muonium signal was eliminated, indicating that the observed muonium stays outside the platinum particles. The result on the platinum surface treated by hydrogen but exposed to oxygen gas suggests a reactive collision between muonium and oxygen adsorbed atomically on the surface.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,FAC SCI,MESON SCI LAB,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI SPIN DYNAMICS IN A SITE-DILUTED FINITE SPIN CLUSTER SYSTEM PROBED BY
   POSITIVE MUONS
SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT Yamada Conference 34 / 9th International Conference on Hyperfine
   Interactions ( HFI-IX )
CY AUG 17-21, 1992
CL TOYONAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
HO OSAKA UNIV, FAC SCI, DEPT PHYS & LAB NUCL STUDIES
ID ANTI-FERROMAGNETS
AB The site diluted finite spin cluster system Rb2CoxMg1-xF4 (x = 0.15, 0.4, 0.5) has been investigated by the mu+SR technique. Muon spin relaxation was observed in these diluted magnetic systems in a weak longitudinal field of 100 G. By reducing temperature below 100 K, the experimental data show features of slowing down phenomena of the Co electron moments in the finite spin clusters.

TI PHOTODIODES CONSTRUCTED BY LB FILMS OF POLYIMIDES POSSESSING
   TRIPHENYLAMINE UNITS
SO MOLECULAR CRYSTALS AND LIQUID CRYSTALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT KOREA / JAPAN JOINT FORUM 91 : ORGANIC THIN FILMS
CY OCT 23-24, 1991
CL SEOUL, SOUTH KOREA
SP KOREA INST SCI & TECHNOL, JAPANESE RES ASSOC ORGANIC ELECTR MAT
ID LANGMUIR-BLODGETT FILMS; MOLECULAR PHOTODIODES; MULTILAYER FILMS;
   ELECTRON-DONOR; SENSITIZER; MONOLAYER; ACCEPTOR; DERIVATIVES
AB Diaminotriphenylamines 4 possessing four different substituents were newly synthesized, and introduced to polyamic acids 6 by the reaction with aliphatic tetracarboxylic dianhydride 5. The LB films of polyimides 8 having triphenylamine units were fabricated on a glassy carbon electrode via the LB films of long chain alkylamine salts of 6 to measure cyclic voltammograms. The methoxy substituted triphenylamine afforded the lowest redox potential, that suggested the highest electron density on the nitrogen atom of the triphenylamine. The photoconductive devices (photodiodes) were constructed by the deposition of polyimides which possessed different chemical structure, i.e., triphenylamines as an electron donor (D), tetraphenylporphyrin as a sensitizer (S), and aromatic polyimide as an electron acceptor (A), giving polyimide LB multilayer films. Two types of photodiodes having E/D/S/A and E/A/S/D were prepared on the semitransparent gold electrodes (E). When the methoxy substituted triphenylamine was used as D layer, the highest photocurrent of 3 muA/cm2 was obtained. The order of magnitude of photocurrent was in good agreement with the results of cyclic voltammometry. The dependence of numbers of D, S, and A layers on the photocurrent was examined by changing the number of each layer. It was found that the triphenylamine units had excellent electron donating ability and hole mobility, whereas the S and A layers did not transfer electron effectively.
C1 TOKYO INST TECHNOL,DEPT ORGAN & POLYMER MAT,MEGURO KU,TOKYO 152,JAPAN.

TI MUONIUM FORMATION ON POWDERED PLATINUM SURFACES
SO CHEMICAL PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
AB Muonium formation was verified in platinum powders under vacuum by muonium spin rotation (MuSR) spectroscopy. Muonium yields of 13(1)% and 9(3)% per incident muon were obtained for Pt powders with mean particle diameters of 30 and 200 nm, respectively. The disappearance of the muonium signal under oxygenic or atmospheric environment indicates that muonium stays outside the Pt particles. It can be postulated that reactive collision between muonium and atomic oxygen is a predominant process on the platinum surface treated by hydrogen.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,FAC SCI,MESON SCI LAB,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI PREPARATION OF POLYIMIDE LANGMUIR-BLODGETT-FILMS POSSESSING A
   TRIPHENYLAMINE UNIT AND THEIR APPLICATION TO PHOTODIODES
SO THIN SOLID FILMS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON LANGMUIR-BLODGETT FILMS
CY AUG 26-30, 1991
CL PARIS, FRANCE
SP VILLE PARIS, SOC FRANCAISE CHIM, DELEGAT GEN ARMEMENT, USA ARMY, MINIST RECH TECHNOL, SECRETARIAT GEN DEF NATL, RHONE POULENC RECH, CEA, COMMISS EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES, CNRS
ID MULTILAYER FILMS; ELECTRON-DONOR; MONOLAYER; SENSITIZER; ACCEPTOR
AB Photoconductive devices (photodiodes) were constructed by the deposition of polyimide LB multilayer films which possessed different chemical structures, i.e., a triphenylamine unit as an electron donor (D), tetraphenylporphyrin as a sensitizer (S), and aromatic polyimide as an electron acceptor (A). Two types of photodiodes with E/D/S/A and E/A/S/D systems were prepared on a semitransparent gold electrode (E). The dependence of each number of D, S, and A layers on the photocurrent behavior was examined to discuss the electron transfer in each layer.

TI PHOTOCHEMICAL SWITCHING OF ELECTROCHEMICAL PROCESSES ON MODIFIED
   ELECTRODES WITH IONIC SPIROPYRAN LANGMUIR-BLODGETT-FILMS

ID MONOLAYERS; PHOTOCHROMISM; GOLD

TI MU-SR STUDY OF NI(C2H8N2)2NO2CLO4 IN PULSED HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELDS
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 3RD INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON RESEARCH ON HIGH MAGNETIC FIELDS A SATELLITE
   OF THE 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MAGNETISM ( ICM 91 )
CY AUG 29-31, 1991
CL AMSTERDAM, NETHERLANDS
SP KONINKLIJKE NEDERLANDSE AKAD WETENSCHAPPEN, STICHTING FUNDAMENTEEL ONDERZOEK MAT, STICHTING PHYS, UNIV AMSTERDAM, KATHOLIEKE UNIV NIJMEGEN, HOEK LOOS IND GASSES, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS, ELSEVIER SCI PUBL, OCE COPIERS, IBM NEDERLAND
HO UNIV AMSTERDAM
ID ANTIFERROMAGNET NI(C2H8N2)2NO2(CLO4); HEISENBERG-ANTIFERROMAGNET
AB We have performed mu-SR experiments on a Haldane gap material [Ni(C2H8N2)2NO2Cl4O4] from room temperature down to 4.2 K in magnetic fields up to 12.5 T.  It has been found that the temperature dependence of the relaxation rate is different from that obtained by NMR because of the difference of sites and the characteristic observation time ranges between NMR and mu-SR.  The very fast relaxation time has been observed at high field and it may be ascribed to a strong internal field which comes from the superhyperfine interaction due to a strong coupling of muon with (NO2)- radical between Ni2+ ions in a chain.

TI MU-SR STUDY OF PRCO2SI2 IN PULSED HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELD
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MAGNETISM
CY SEP 02-06, 1991
CL EDINBURGH, SCOTLAND
AB Mu-SR experiments have been performed on metamagnetic PrCo2Si2 at zero field at various temperatures down to 4.2 K and at high magnetic fields up to 13 T, well above the saturation field at 4.2 K.  Large changes of the relaxation rates have been observed at the critical temperatures, where the magnetic structure changes.  At high field, the relaxation rates have been found to be large.  This effect is considered to be due to the spin fluctuations which occur in the long-period structure phases.

TI DIRECT OBSERVATION OF A DIAMAGNETIC PRODUCT IN GAS-PHASE REACTIONS OF
   MUONIUM BY MUON SPIN-RESONANCE
SO CHEMICAL PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID CHEMISTRY; KINETICS; EXCHANGE; F2
AB The diamagnetic muon spin-resonance method was developed fora reaction of Cl2 with muonium (Mu) formed in a Krand Ar atmosphere. A diamagnetic product was measured directly by the resonance method. The rate constant of its formation in Kr at 12.2 atm was 5.05(9) x 10(10) l mol-1 s-1. By comparison with the rate constant of Mu decay measured by the muon spin-rotation method, it is concluded that MuCl produced from Mu in collision with Cl2 is detected as the diamagnetic-mu+ by the resonance method and that Mu decays either through a chemical reaction with Cl2 or Mu-spin depolarization caused by slowing-down of mu+.  A similar experiment in Ar suggests formation of other products.

TI CO2(CO)8-CATALYZED CARBONYLATION OF ACETALS USING N-SILYLAMINES
SO JOURNAL OF MOLECULAR CATALYSIS
LA English
DT Article
ID RHODIUM-CATALYZED HYDROFORMYLATION; CARBON-MONOXIDE; CYCLIC ETHERS;
   FORMALDEHYDE; HYDROSILANE; KINETICS
AB Formaldehyde dialkyl acetals and cyclic acetal, 1,3-dioxolane, are smoothly carbonylated using N-silylamines at 140-160-degrees-C under 70-88 kg cm-2 CO pressure in the presence of a catalytic amount of Co2(CO)8 to give the corresponding 2-alkoxyamides in moderate to good yields. In the carbonylation of formaldehyde dialkyl acetals using N-silylamines, addition of pyridine drastically enhances the catalytic activity.

TI SUPERCONDUCTING, ELECTRONIC AND MAGNETIC-ANOMALIES DUE TO STRUCTURAL
   TRANSITION AROUND X=0.12 IN LA2-XBAXCUO4
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
   : HIGH TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
SP CITY KANAZAWA, ISHIKAWA PREFECTURE
ID PHASE
AB From anomalies of the heat capacity and the thermal expansion, the structural phase boundary of the LTT-LTO transition is determined in the narrow range around x = 0.12 of La2-xBaxCuO4, where superconductivity is suppressed remarkably.  The widely-spread Cu-NQR spectra and the decay of the asymmetry parameter of mu-SR are indicative of the magnetic order of Cu moments in the LTT phase where the induced charge transfer between Cu and O atoms causes the localization of the electronic state and the increase of magnetic moments at the Cu site.

TI NEGATIVE MUON SPIN ROTATION STUDIES ON SINGLE-CRYSTAL LA2CUO4+DELTA
   ABOVE TN
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
   : HIGH TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
SP CITY KANAZAWA, ISHIKAWA PREFECTURE
ID YBA2CU3O7
AB The negative muon spin rotation (mu-SR) experiments have been performed on the La2CuO4+delta single crystals (T(N) = 255K) in the paramagnetic region.  The temperature dependence of the two components of paramagnetic shift was obtained from the electron spectrum emitted from mu-O.  The hyperfine coupling constants, A(hf)1 and A(hf)2 (A(hf)1 > A(hf)2) obtained from the K - chi-plot are proposed to be ascribed to the O(1) and O(2) sites, respectively.

TI NEGATIVE MUON SPIN ROTATION IN YBA2CU3OX (X=7, 6.5 AND 6)
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
   : HIGH TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
SP CITY KANAZAWA, ISHIKAWA PREFECTURE
AB By negative muon spin rotation method (mu-SR) the paramgnetic shifts of muonic oxygen, K-mu-, have been measured in the paramagnetic phase of YBa2Cu3O6; K-mu-is 4.6 +/- 1.9 x 10(-4) at 500 K and 8.7 +/- 1.7 x 10(4) at 550 K.  In the normal state of the superconducting YBa2Cu3O7, GdBa2Cu3O7 and YBa2Cu3O6.5 K-mu-'s have not been determined due to a very fast mu- spin relaxation time, T2star.  This mu-SR results in stoichiometric YBa2Cu3Ox makes a contarst with those in doped superconductor La2-xSrxCuO4-delta, in which T2star do not show any drastic change in superconducting and insulating phases.

TI RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN CRYSTAL-STRUCTURE AND LONG-TIME RESPONSE TO DC
   ELECTRIC-FIELD IN NIOBIUM-DOPED BATIO3 CERAMICS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE BATIO3; DONOR DOPANTS; CRYSTAL STRUCTURE; PSEUDO-CUBIC; ATOMIC
   COORDINATE; PHASE TRANSITION; AGING OF PERMITTIVITY; PIEZOELECTRIC
   RESONANCE; RESPONSE OF LATTICE
AB The precise crystal structure and its relationship to the electrical properties were investigated for the BaTiO3-CoO-Nb2O5 system.  It was observed with X-ray diffraction that the crystal structure changed from tetragonal to pseudo-cubic with the addition of Nb2O5 of more than 0.8 mol%.  The lattice structure parameters of a sample containing 0.25 mol% of Co3O4 and 1.0 mol% of Nb2O5 were obtained by two-phase Rietveld refinement using time-of-flight (TOF) neutron diffraction.  Ti atoms were displaced from an ideal position at (1/2 1/2 1/2) in the major phase.  The change in the crystal structure coincided with a decrease of the degree of capacitance change under a DC electric field, an almost complete disappearance of piezoelectric resonance, and a decrease of the jump in thermal expansion.  The pseudo-cubic structure was stable under a DC electric field of 6 V/mu-m.
C1 NATL INST RES INORGAN MAT,SAKURA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI SECY IS AN INDISPENSABLE COMPONENT OF THE PROTEIN SECRETORY MACHINERY OF
   ESCHERICHIA-COLI
SO BIOCHIMICA ET BIOPHYSICA ACTA
LA English
DT Article
DE SECY; PROTEIN SECRETION; RECONSTITUTION; OMPT; ANTI-SECY ANTIBODY
ID PROTON MOTIVE FORCE; MEMBRANE-VESICLES; EXPORTED PROTEINS; INVITRO
   TRANSLOCATION; PLASMA-MEMBRANE; SIGNAL PEPTIDE; RECONSTITUTION; MUTANT;
   GENE; PRLA
AB Using a reconstitution system for protein translocation, the involvement of SecY in the translocation of secretory proteins across the cytoplasmic membrane of Escherichia coli was studied.  Anti-SecY antibodies raised against the N-and C-terminal sequences prevented the functional reconstitution of the translocation system.  Depletion of SecY from the solubilized membrane preparation was performed by treatment with anti-SecY IgG, followed by removal of IgG with protein A-agarose.  The SecY-depleted preparation was inactive as to functional reconstitution.  However, reconstitution with it was demonstrated in the presence of a protein fraction, which was released from the anti-SecY immunoprecipitate upon addition of the SecY fragment used to raise the antibody.  Reconstitution with the SecY-depleted membrane fraction was also demonstrated in the presence of a purified SecY preparation.  OmpT proteinase specifically cleaved SecY in the solubilized membrane preparation.  The cleavage was accompanied by a decrease in the reconstituted activity.  Based on these findings we conclude that SecY is an indispensable component of the secretory machinery.
RP NISHIYAMA, K (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,INST APPL MICROBIOL,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI BRILLOUIN SPECTROSCOPY OF SPIN-WAVES IN SPUTTERED COPT ALLOY-FILMS AND
   CO/PT/CO MULTILAYERED FILMS
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 35TH ANNUAL CONF ON MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
CY OCT 29-NOV 01, 1990
CL SAN DIEGO, CA
SP AMER INST PHYS, IEEE, MAGNET SOC, AMER INST MIN MET & PETR ENGINEERS, MET SOC, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, AMER SOC TESTING & MAT, AMER PHYS SOC, AMER CERAM SOC
ID FERROMAGNETIC DOUBLE-LAYER; THIN-FILMS; MEDIA; MODES
AB Sputtered Co1-xPt(x) (x = 0-0.14) alloy films have been studied by Brillouin scattering of spin waves and compared with results on Co/Pt/Co multilayered films.  Brillouin spectra of the surface spin waves in the sputtered alloy films are remarkably broadened as an increase of the Pt content.  The in-plane coercivity of the films also increases as the increase of the Pt content, which indicates larger and better oriented grains with proper separations that result from higher Pt content.  The broadening of the spin-wave spectra is caused by the magnetic inhomogeneity due to the grains in the film.  The exchange stiffness constant of the CoPt alloy films is determined from the magnetic field dependence of the frequency shifts of the surface and standing spin waves.  To investigate the exchange interaction in the inhomogeneous alloy films, Co/Pt/Co multilayered films with the Pt interlayer of thickness of 0-40 angstrom have been fabricated as a model material.  From the analysis of the frequency shifts of the spin waves, the exchange interaction between Co layers through the Pt interlayer is evaluated.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,SCI MEASUREMENTS RES INST,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.
RP MURAYAMA, A (reprint author), ASAHI GLASS CO LTD,CENT RES LAB,YONEZAWA,YAMAGATA 99211,JAPAN.

TI PURIFICATION OF SECE AND RECONSTITUTION OF SECE-DEPENDENT PROTEIN
   TRANSLOCATION ACTIVITY
SO FEBS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE OVERPRODUCTION; PROTEIN SECRETION; RECONSTITUTION; SECE; SECY
ID PROTON MOTIVE FORCE; COLI MEMBRANE-VESICLES; ESCHERICHIA-COLI; INVITRO
   TRANSLOCATION; GENE
AB SecE was solubilized from SecE-overproducing E. coli cells and purified through ion exchange and size exclusion chromatographies.  When the solubilized membrane containing overproduced amounts of SecY and SecE was fractionated by means of size exclusion chromatography, the two proteins were eluted in different fractions with slight overlapping.  Proteoliposomes active in protein translocation were reconstituted from these fractions only when both SecE and SecY were present.  When reconstitution was carried out with the purified SecE and fractions containing SecY but only a small amount of SecE, the resultant proteoliposomes exhibited appreciable translocation activity, indicating that SecE is essential for protein translocation.  The translocation activity of proteoliposomes was proportional to the amount of purified SecE used for reconstitution.  SecE-dependent protein translocation absolutely required ATP and SecA.
RP TOKUDA, H (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,INST APPL MICROBIOL,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI CLASSIFICATION OF IRREDUCIBLE SUPER-UNITARY REPRESENTATIONS OF SU(P,Q/N)
SO COMMUNICATIONS IN MATHEMATICAL PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID LIE-SUPERALGEBRAS; WEIGHT REPRESENTATIONS; ALGEBRAS; SUPERSYMMETRY
AB In this paper we classify all the irreducible super-unitary representations of su(p, q/n), which can be integrated up to a unitary representation of S(U(p, q) x U(n)), a Lie group corresponding to the even part of su(p, q/n). Note that a real form of the Lie superalgebra sI(m/n; C) which has non-trivial super-unitary representations is of the form su(p, q/n)(p + q = m) or su(m/r, s)(r + s = n). Moreover, we give an explicit realization for each irreducible super-unitary representation, using the oscillator representation of an orthosymplectic Lie superalgebra.
C1 KYOTO UNIV,YOSHIDA COLL,DEPT MATH,SAKYO KU,KYOTO 606,JAPAN.
RP FURUTSU, H (reprint author), NIHON UNIV,COLL SCI & TECHNOL,DEPT MATH,KANDA SURUGADAI 1-8,CHIYODA KU,TOKYO 101,JAPAN.

   Enright T. J., 1983, REPRESENTATION THEOR, P97

TI PROBING OXYGEN IN HIGH-TC SUPERCONDUCTOR LASRCUO BY NEGATIVE MUONS
SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MUON SPIN ROTATION RELAXATION AND RESONANCE
CY APR 09-12, 1990
CL OXFORD, ENGLAND
HO WADHAM COLL
ID VALENCE BOND STATE; OXIDES; YBA2CU3O7; SYSTEM
AB A novel microscopic method of muon spin rotation for negative muon (mu-) attached to oxygen is applied on high T(c) materials LaSrCuO.  The paramagnetic shift and relaxation rate are measured as a function of Sr concentration and temperature.  Analysis shows the large difference in shift and relaxation between two different sites.  A large anisotropy was also observed by preliminary measurements along different crystalline axes.

TI MU-SR STUDIES OF OXIDE-SUPERCONDUCTORS
SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MUON SPIN ROTATION RELAXATION AND RESONANCE
CY APR 09-12, 1990
CL OXFORD, ENGLAND
HO WADHAM COLL
ID YBA2CU3O7
AB The negative muon spin rotation method (mu-SR) has been applied to studies of electronic states at oxygen sites of oxide superconductors YBa2Cu3O7, Nd(2-x)Ce(x)CuO4-delta (x = 0.15, oxygen reduced), LiTi2O4 and related oxide-insulators La2CuO4-delta, CuO, Cu2O.  The paramagnetic shifts of mu- trapped at oxygen nuclei in these polycrystalline powder samples have been measured at 300 K.  All the measured shifts are positive.  In copper-oxides the paramagnetic shifts are of the order 10(-3), while in LiTi2O4 is very small (8.4 +/- 3.34 x 10(-5)).  In YBa2Cu3O7, a fast mu- spin relaxation time T2* (approximately 200 ns) has been observed; the reason for this is unknown and further studies are now in progress.
C1 NIPPON TELEGRAPH & TEL PUBL CORP,OPTOELECTR LABS,TOKAI,IBARAKI 31911,JAPAN.
   UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.

   UNIV TOKYO,MESON SCI LAB-06A,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
   TRI UNIV MESON FACIL,VANCOUVER,BC,CANADA.
   INST NUCL STUDY,TANASHI,TOKYO,JAPAN.

TI EVIDENCE FOR MUONIUM EMISSION FROM AN SIO2 LAYER ON N-TYPE SI AND THE
   POSITIVE MUON STATE IN SI
SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MUON SPIN ROTATION RELAXATION AND RESONANCE
CY APR 09-12, 1990
CL OXFORD, ENGLAND
HO WADHAM COLL
ID THERMAL MUONIUM; SPIN-RESONANCE; VACUUM; POWDERS
AB Evidence for the emission of slow muonium atoms from a 3.0-nm-thick SiO2 layer covered on an n-type Si is reported.  Also, upon applying an rf-resonance technique at the muon frequency, a time-differential observation of a delayed state-change from muonium to diamagnetic muon at room temperature was observed.  Combining results obtained by use of longitudinal field decoupling and transverse spin rotation methods, the conversion rate was estimated to be 5 to 10-mu-s-1.  Both of the above results, namely the observation of the emission and state-change of muonium, suggest a process in which mu-+ initially captures an electron from Si, then quickly converts to mu-+ again during thermal diffusion in the Si towards the SiO2 layer.  Within the oxide layer, muonium is again formed and subsequently is emitted from the SiO2 surface.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.
   UNIV TOKYO,MESON SCI LAB,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
   UNIV BRITISH COLUMBIA,DEPT CHEM,VANCOUVER V6T 1Y6,BC,CANADA.
   TOHOKU UNIV,DEPT ELECTR,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI APPLICATION OF PULSED HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELD TO MU-SR STUDIES
SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MUON SPIN ROTATION RELAXATION AND RESONANCE
CY APR 09-12, 1990
CL OXFORD, ENGLAND
HO WADHAM COLL
AB The technical development in the production of pulsed high magnetic field to be used for mu-SR studies is described.  A pulsed field up to 16 T with half-sine wave shape and 1 msec duration is repeated every 2 sec and the muon beam pulses are synchronized at the peak of the field.  Paramagnetic relaxation measurement on MnO has been performed at above 10 T as a test of this equipment and relaxation in PrCo2Si2 has been studied in the vicinity of the metamagnetic transition at 12 T at He temperature.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,FAC SCI,MESON SCI LAB,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI MU-SR AND MOSSBAUER STUDIES ON SEMICONDUCTING

SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English

CY APR 09-12, 1990
CL OXFORD, ENGLAND
SP SCI & ENGN RES COUNCIL
HO WADHAM COLL
AB mu-SR and Fe-57 Mossbauer spectroscopy were used to study the magnetic properties of powders of semiconducting YBa, (Cu0.95 Fe0.05)3O6+delta using the same sample in the temperature range from 4-300 K.  TF and ZF mu-SR were performed at the BOOM facility at KEK using the pulsed surface beam.
